nodes.name: Sticky Note1

parameters.content:
# Welcome to my Automated Image Metadata Tagging Workflow!

This workflow automatically analyzes the image content with the help of AI and writes it directly back into the image file as keywords.

## This workflow has the following sequence:

1. Google Drive trigger (scan for new files added in a specific folder)
2. Download the added image file
3. Analyse the content of the image
4. Merge Metadata and image file
5. Write the Keywords into the Metadata (dc:subject/keywords) and create new image file
6. Update the original file in the Google Drive folder

## The following accesses are required for the workflow:
- You have to install the [n8n-nodes-exif-data Community Node]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}
- Google Drive: [Documentation]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}
- AI API access (e.g. via OpenAI, Anthropic, Google or Ollama)

You can contact me via LinkedIn, if you have any questions: {{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# Automated Image Metadata Tagging (Community Node)

## Overview
Automated workflow: Automated Image Metadata Tagging (Community Node). This workflow integrates 7 different services: stickyNote, googleDriveTrigger, merge, googleDrive, stopAndError. It contains 11 nodes and follows best practices for error handling and security.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 11
- **Node Types**: 7
- **Error Handling**: ✅ Implemented
- **Security**: ✅ Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: ✅ Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **Trigger: New file added to Google Drive Folder**: googleDriveTrigger
- **Download Image File**: googleDrive
- **Analyze Image Content**: openAi
- **Merge Metadata and Image File**: merge
- **Write Metadata into Image**: exifData
- **Update Image File**: googleDrive
- **Sticky Note1**: stickyNote
- **Error Handler for b0b030f5**: stopAndError
- **Error Handler for 1df51279**: stopAndError
- **Error Handler for 50a59e8e**: stopAndError
- ... and 1 more nodes

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible
